newsitem.title: JAPAN: NEC to join microchip project in China--paper.
newsitem.headline: NEC to join microchip project in China--paper.

text.p: NEC Corp plans to set up a joint venture with a Chinese partner to participate in China's $1 billion national microchip project, a Japanese newspaper said on Thursday.
The venture will be formed with Shanghai Huahong Microelectronics Co and will be capitalised at $700 million, the Nihon Keizai Shimbun said.
The Chinese partner will take a stake of more than half in the joint venture, the paper said without elaborating on the expected amount of NEC's investment in the venture or the overall project.

The Chinese government intends to produce microchips on eight-inch wafers, using 0.5 to 0.35 micron technology, the paper said. It is seeking participation of semiconductor makers in Japan, the United States and Europe.
The joint venture, to be capable of producing about 20,000 wafers a month, is expected to start operations next year, the paper said.
An NEC spokesman was not immediately available for comment on the report.
